data.title: Mortal Kombat Star Bridgette Wilson Goes Public With Cancer Diagnosis
data.meta_description: Bridgette Wilson-Sampras who played Sonya Blade in 1995's Mortal Kombat live-action movie adaptation reveals her battle with ovarian cancer.
data.text:
Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, who played Sonya Blade in the 1995 Mortal Kombat film, has revealed her battle with ovarian cancer.

Wilson-Sampras’ tennis star husband Pete Sampras announced the cancer diagnosis in a statement posted to X. “As most have come to know, I am a pretty quiet and private person,” Sampras said. “However, this past year has been an exceptionally challenging time for my family and I have decided to share what’s been going on. Last December, my wife, Bridgette, was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. Since then, she has had major surgery, pushed through chemotherapy and continues with targeted maintenance therapy.”

Sampras continued by discussing the difficulty of seeing his spouse deal with the life-threatening illness and how the couple’s two children stepped up in such a traumatic time. As Wilson-Sampras continues to get medical care, her husband asks for the public’s support.

“With that said, I will end this by humbly asking for good thoughts and prayers for our family as Bridgette continues to thrive on her healing journey. Thank you,” Sampras said.

The career of Bridgette Wilson-Sampras

Crowned Miss Teen USA at age 17 and making her acting star on the soap opera Santa Barbara in 1992, Wilson-Sampras made her big screen debut as Arnold Schwarzenegger‘s daughter in 1993’s Last Action Hero. She played significant roles opposite Adam Sandler in 1995’s Billy Madison and supporting roles in 1997’s I Know What You Did Last Summer and 2001’s The Wedding Planner. Wilson-Sampras’ last credited role was in the 2008 movie Phantom Punch with Ving Rhames as boxing legend Sonny Liston.
